Package com.example.appointment.controller

Class ViewCustomersController

java.lang.Object
com.example.appointment.controller.Controller
com.example.appointment.controller.MainController
com.example.appointment.controller.ViewCustomersController
All Implemented Interfaces:
AppointmentAlertsInterface, GetAppointmentsInterface, GetCustomersInterface, SQLControllerInterface
public class ViewCustomersController extends MainController implements GetAppointmentsInterface, GetCustomersInterface
A Controller for the view customer page of the program. It displays the customer TableView and a variety of options to select different pages. This also includes methods for adding, modifying and deleting customers.

  • Field Details

    • customerIdsWithAppointments

      protected List<Integer> customerIdsWithAppointments
      A list of customers who have appointments. This is important because customers cannot be deleted if they have an appointment.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewCustomersController

      public ViewCustomersController()

  • Method Details

    • setCustomersIdsWithAppointments

      public void setCustomersIdsWithAppointments() throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that sets up the customerIdsWithAppointments list so that it's updated with every customer that has an active appointment. It works by getting a list of appointments for every user, if the customer ID of that appointment is not in the list of customer IDs with appointments, then it is added.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • setCustomerDivisionNameHashMap

      protected HashMap<Integer,String> setCustomerDivisionNameHashMap() throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that sets up the customer division name HashMap so that it can be accessed for by the division ComboBox. This works by connecting to the database, and retrieving the division ID as they key, and the Division as the value, for each customer.
      Returns:
      A HashMap of the customer division ID as they key and the division as the value.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • setCustomerTableView

      public void setCustomerTableView() throws IOException, SQLException
      A method that sets up the TableView object by retrieving customer objects from the database, adding them to an observable list and then displaying that list in the table.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.
      SQLException - If the database error occurs.

    • changeAddCustomerScene

      public void changeAddCustomerScene(ActionEvent event) throws IOException, SQLException
      A method that changes the scene to the add customers page. It loads the setCustomerCountryComboBox method so that the countries, and divisions are selectable from the controller.
      Parameters:
      event - Takes in that the Add Customer button was pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.
      SQLException - If the database error occurs.

    • changeModifyCustomerScene

      public void changeModifyCustomerScene(ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Changes the scene to the modify customer scene. If no customer is selected from the table an error message is generated.
      Parameters:
      event - Passes in that the modify customer button was pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the fxml file cannot be found, or if a different I/O error occurs.

    • deleteCustomer

      public void deleteCustomer(ActionEvent event)
      A method that allows a selected customer to be deleted from the database. After the customer is deleted the setCustomerTableView method is called again to refresh the displayed customers. If no customer is selected it will generate an error message from the getSelectedCustomerFromTable() method. If the customer has an appointment then the method throws an exception that is caught and generates an error message.
      Parameters:
      event - - Passes in that the delete customer button was pressed.

    • getSelectedCustomerFromTable

      public Customer getSelectedCustomerFromTable()
      Gets the selected customer object from the TableView so that it can be passed into a method to be modified or deleted.
      Returns:
      The selected customer from the TableView.

    • changeSceneToMainControllerViewByWeek

      public void changeSceneToMainControllerViewByWeek(ActionEvent event)
      A method that changes the scene to the main controller page to display appointments by week when the view all appointments radio button is pressed. This method is different from the main controller's changeViewWeek method because the method has to switch the controller and then call the changeViewByWeek method.
      Parameters:
      event - Takes in that the View by Week radio button was pressed.

    • changeSceneToMainControllerViewByMonth

      public void changeSceneToMainControllerViewByMonth(ActionEvent event)
      A method that changes the scene to the main controller page to display appointments by month when the view all appointments radio button is pressed. This method is different from the main controller's changeViewByMonth method because the method has to switch the controller and then call the changeViewMonth method.
      Parameters:
      event - Takes in that the View by Month radio button was pressed.
